basics.name: Daniel Gillies
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Born and raised in New York, moved to the West Coast for new experiences. Travelled the world to compete in video games and now working as a software engineer.

work.summary: Skully is an hardware company manufacturing motorcycle helmets with a heads-up display that features a 180 degree rear-view camera and gps.
highlights: Helped design and build company website
Created app landing screens for tutorial through Skully Systems

work.summary: InstaEDU is an online help center for students needing tutoring. It easily and quickly connects students and educators.
highlights: Online tutor for computer science, programming, web development, Spanish, and mathematics

work.summary: Kineviz is a data visualization company that uses interactive demos and art to help display data in a more meaningful way.
highlights: Designed and built a full-stack web application to visualize twitter and audio data in a 3D virtual world
Integrated Oculus Rift, Wii Balance Board, and Microsoft Kinect
Invited to present the project for Autodesk's 3D Webfest, along with top WebGL developers

volunteer.summary: Taught middle-school girls the basics of programming and computer science in an after school program

awards.title: 3D Webfest Recognized Project
awards.summary: Built a WebGL application to visualize twitter and audio data in an artistic manner. The project was put on display at Autodesk's 3D Webfest.

awards.title: Electronic Sports World Cup
awards.summary: Qualified to represent North America in an international LAN event in Paris, France for the title of world champion

awards.title: 1st Place, PAX East 2014
awards.summary: Won the PAX East open qualifier for the IGN Pro League Season 6 championships with a prize pool of $100,000

awards.title: Shootmania Launch Tournament
awards.summary: Qualified to be flown out to San Francisco, CA to compete in a top-16 event for $100,000 and the title of world champion
